c74object.name: timefilter
c74object.digest: Filter a list to remove values that are too close together
c74object.description: Originally intended for use with lists representing time values as part of a system of gestural representation, timefilter is an object for filtering and reordering values in a list of numbers. The stored list is first sorted (if desired) either into ascending order or randomly. Values may then either be filtered randomly, or according to a minimum required distance between values (originally to avoid events timed too closely together), or a combination of the two. The object may obviously be used on lists representing any parameter and in various other scenarios than the one from which it takes its name.

method.name: bang
method.description: Output the list after sorting and filtering. Then clear to prepare for the next input.

method.name: float
method.description: Set a float to determine the minimum distance between items in the list. Items that do no satisfy this limit are filtered out.

method.name: list
method.digest: Set the list to be filtered
method.description: Set the list to be reordered and filtered when timefilter recieves a bang.

method.name: ordering
method.digest: Set the ordering mode of the list
method.description:
Set the ordering mode for the list processing. This determines the order before filtering is applied.
ordering 0 - sort in ascending order
ordering 1 - random sort
ordering 2 - maintain input ordering

method.name: randfilter
method.description:
Set a ratio by which to randomly filter the list.
The message should be formatted as:
randfilter / float (0-1)
Ex. randfilter 0.2 will randomly filter out 20% of items.

method.name: reset
method.description: Clear the input list without outputting.

entry.name: list
entry.description: Outputs the input list as floats after being ordered then filtered.
